subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Evolutionary Roots of Biased Thinking
description: Learn The Evolutionary Roots of Biased Thinking in one minute.

hook.text: A rustle in the grass. Is it wind or a tiger? Your ancestors who assumed tiger survived. The relaxed ones didn't.

buildup.text: Negativity bias, loss aversion, and in-group preference all trace back to survival pressures on the savanna.

discovery.text: False positives (seeing a threat that isn't there) cost little. False negatives (missing a real threat) cost your life.

twist.text: Modern life reversed the equation. Now false positives cost us â€” panic sells, fear drives bad investments.

climax.text: Our biases aren't flaws â€” they're ancient survival tools misapplied to a world our brains didn't evolve for.

punchline.text: Your brain is set for the savanna. You live in a city.

quiz.question: Why did evolution favor cognitive biases?
options: False positives were cheaper than false negatives for survival
